content.webTitle: UK men exceed limit on working hours

fields.headline: UK men exceed limit on working hours
fields.bodyText: Almost a quarter of men work longer than the European limit for working hours, according to research out today. Based on analysis of the most recent census, Britain's general union GMB said that more than 3 million men work 49 hours or more a week. In Kensington and Chelsea, as many as 42% of male workers exceed the EU's limit of a 48-hour working week. The City of London and Westminster are close behind, with 41% and 37% respectively. Least likely to work more than 48 hours are people in Belfast and Gwent, where only 14% of men do more than a 48-hour week. On average, women's working hours are far lower, due to a larger number of part-time workers and women taking time out to care for children. Only 5.8% of women in England and Wales work more than 48 hours. However, in Kensington and Chelsea and the City of London, that figure rises to almost one in five.
